Description.val: This line item funds modifications to the (11) VH-3D, (8) VH-60N, (1) UH-3D, and (1) UH-60N. These aircraft are assigned to Marine Helicopter Squadron One to support the President of the United States. The VH-60N Cockpit Upgrade consists of an upgrade to all-glass instrumentation. The Communication Suite Upgrade consists of Demand Assigned Multiple Access Satellite Communication radio upgrade, Digital Frequency Modulation radio upgrade, High Frequency radio upgrade, the Presidential redundant secure communications upgrade, Data Transfer capability upgrade, and Crypto Modernization Upgrade.  The Structural Enhancement Program replaces critical aircraft structure on the VH-60N, upgrades the safety of the fuel system on the VH-3D, and a Service Life Extension on the VH-3D and VH-60N. The Obsolescence Management Program will manage impending Executive Helicopter obsolescence issues. A variety of factors will be addressed including communication, navigation, operational weight, safety, and engine upgrades to remain mission relevant. An H-3 and H-60 will be converted to a UH-3D and UH-60N to reduce usage on the VH-3D and VH-60N.  This reduction in utilization provides for better availability and enhanced sustainability. The VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade consists of an upgrade to all-glass instrumentation. The overall goals of the modifications budgeted in FY 2015 are to continue procurement efforts in accordance with the procurement strategy to maintain the VH-3D and VH-60N until the VXX Replacement Helicopter becomes fully operationally capable.

Justification.val: Changes from FY14 to FY15 are directly related to the reprogramming of funds to support the unplanned requirements associated with keeping the existing fleet of Presidential VH-3's and VH-60's safely operating beyond their originally planned service life until replaced by VXX.  Requirements include obsolescence issues and safety improvements such as weight reduction efforts, incorporation of a crash worthy cabin seat and structural improvements that are addressed via the Service Life Enhancement Program (SLEP).

Name.@footnote: Additional funding was added in FY14 and FY15 to implement a new Integrated Standby Instrument System (ISIS). The funding in FY14 completed the Preplanned Product Improvement, as well as supported ISIS testing. The funding in FY15 will support ISIS testing as well as field activity support for fielding ISIS.
The VH-60N Standby Instruments will be installed at O-level.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  In order to meet the requirement of providing safe and timely transportation for the President, Vice President, and other parties as directed by the Director of the White House Military Office (WHMO), and in support of the alert and contingency mission requirement of the WHMO Operations Plan, the VH-60N aircraft cockpit must be upgraded to provide enhanced communication, navigation, and survivability capabilities while reducing pilot workload.  The cockpit upgrade will be an all-glass instrumentation built around pilot, co-pilot, and Communications Systems Operator Multi-Function Displays and Control Display Units.  A moving map display complete with terrain database will be incorporated, while maintaining the current capabilities of Tactical Air Navigation, Variable Omni Receiver, Instrument Landing System, Automatic Direction Finding, Traffic Collision Avoidance System, Crash Survivable Flight Instrument Recorder, FM Immunity, Mode S Identification, Friend or Foe, ALE-47 and ALQ-144.  The Survivability capabilities will provide a countermeasure dispenser and an infrared countermeasure system interface. The navigation system will include laser ring gyro Inertial Navigation Systems with embedded Global Positioning System (GPS)-(EGI) that has integrity monitoring/Instrumented Flight Rules.  A color weather radar will be incorporated. Communication capabilities must be consistent with White House Communications Agency (WHCA) planning and National Security Agency requirements.  Three Ultra High Frequency/Very High Frequency/Frequency Modulation (FM) radios (ARC-210s) shall be included.  Two FM radios and the High Frequency with ALE currently on the VH-60N must be maintained.  A coupled autopilot function shall be incorporated into the cockpit management system. Preplanned Product Improvement will include Digital Map, Ground Proximity Warning System, Communication, Navigation and Surveillance/ Air Traffic Management, and GPS Non-precision approach (Required Navigation Performance/Required Navigation). In FY14, FY15 and FY16, funding will implement a new Integrated Standby Instrument System (ISIS).  

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  This Acquisition Category (ACAT) IV-T program was approved in July 2001.  Milestone B was approved November 2003.  The program was re-designated as ACAT IV-M in November 2003.  Milestone C was approved April 2006.  Test bed aircraft modification and first kit procurement began in FY 2006.  Installation of 1st production kit began in FY 2008.  Development Testing was completed in FY 2009.  Full Rate Production was approved August 2009.   Initial Operating Capability was achieved in February 2010, with Full Operating Capability scheduled for FY 2014. Preplanned Product Improvement efforts began in FY 2009 and will finish in FY 2014.   

  

Notes:  
1.  The VH-60N Standby Instruments will be installed at O-level.					
2.  Installs must follow Special Progressive Aircraft Rework schedule.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The White House Military Office (WHMO) has directed that Very High Frequency Frequency Modulation (FM) radios operate in the APCO-25 digital mode. New radios were procured in order to meet this requirement.  Joint Chiefs of Staff Directive MJCS-63-89 states that all users of Ultra High Frequency SATCOM shall have demand assigned multiple access (DAMA) capability.  The White House Communication Agency (WHCA) has directed that all WHMO elements be connected and have the ability to operate in the DAMA mode by 2005.  Satisfaction of the DAMA SATCOM requirement required the incorporation of two DAMA capable radios in each aircraft to satisfy the need for full duplex communication.  An install kit was built to house the radio, amplifier, and aircraft interface module, and then it will be installed in the aircraft as one unit.  WHCA also directed that all WHMO elements have the ability to operate in the HF/Automatic Link Establishment (ALE) mode by 2007.  To meet the HF/ALE requirement, software modifications to the Operational Flight Program (OFP) were completed to fully utilize all ALE capabilities of the current HF radio.  OFP software was modified by Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division (NAWC-AD) to allow new systems to work in the aircraft. The FM (YZ) radio replacement is required in order to have a redundant secure voice capability due to the obsolescence of the YZ radio system employed by WHCA. An upgrade to all radios is required to maintain crypto security requirements.  Required upgrades vary from software/firmware mods to the replacement of multiple radios on the VH-3D/VH-60N.  A Wideband Line of Sight (WBLoS) system has been mandated and funded by the Department of Defense Chief Information Officer.  A new radio, antenna, associated accessories, and aircraft integration will be required for this effort and will begin in FY 2016. 


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  This program was approved as an Abbreviated Acquisition Program in July 2001.  Program was upgraded to Acquisition Category IV-M in March 2003 and will complete in 2015.  Digital FM was completed in FY 2005.  The HF/ALE modification was completed in FY 2009. FM radio replacement was completed in FY 2009. The Crypto modernization effort for both aircraft began in FY 2010 and continues through FY 2015.  All performance testing and Electro Magnetic Compatibility/Electro Magnetic Interference testing will be performed by NAWC-AD.  Validation/Verification will be performed by HMX-1 to ensure interoperability with all WHMO elements.  Remaining work is being conducted under an engineering change proposal (ECP).   



Notes:																						
1.  VH-3D/VH-60N Communication Upgrade NRE for B kits includes two (2) test aircraft and five (5) lab assets. 	
2.  FY15 Other Support includes additional Vinson ANDVT Crypto Moderization (VACM) and Electro Magnetic testing (E3) support which is part of Crypto.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The VH Structural Enhancements Program consists of the efforts necessary to extend the service lives of the VH-3D and VH-60N airframes.  Due to the cancellation of the VH-71 program, the VH-3D and VH-60N must stay in service longer to support mission needs.  In order to meet the new usage requirements, a Service Life Extension Program (SLEP)  was established to implement upgrades identified in the Service Life Assessment Program (SLAP).   Additionally, safety upgrades to the VH-3D fuel system will be incorporated.


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Non-Recurring Engineering for the VH-3D and VH-60N  Service Life Extensions began FY 2012.  Non-Recurring Engineering  for the VH-3D Fuel System Upgrades begins in FY 2014.

Notes:
1. VH-3D Fuel System Upgrade A & B kit quantity includes one (1) kit for the NVH test aircraft. 	
2. Installs must follow Special Progressive Aircraft Rework (SPAR) schedule.

Name.@footnote: Increase in FY15 is a result of the start of the Avionics kit and Avionics equipment.  It also includes the replacement of the air vehicle equipment Load Device-2 (LD-2) to support VH-3D requirements.

FY14 and FY15 are unique ILS products interdependent with 401C NRE and VH3D Cabin Interiors NRE lines. FY14 includes Logistics Analysis/Supportability Design Interface for VH 401C. FY15 includes 401C logistics plans/Logistics Management Information (LMI) development and corrections/changes during the mods, and related maintenance task analysis.

Increased due to cancellation of VH-71 and leadership investment in In-Service capabilities (Cabin interior, 401C) to reduce risk related to obsolescence associated with In-Service platforms.  Labor support of 401C, 400C, VH-3D and VH-60N Cabin Interiors, Other OMP support. Funding levels align to peak execution of NRE, installations and test activities.  FY14 Other Support reflects actual support required.
Risk reduction for obsolescence on avionics equipment. Avionics kits will be installed at the O level.
VH-3D Cabin Interior Redesign A kit costs increased during contractor proposal development.  VH-3D Cabin Interior Redesign A kit in FY14 is the validation/verification kit.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  This Operational, Safety, and Improvement Program provides for the readiness of the VH-3D and VH-60N Presidential Helicopters. The projected end of service for the VH-3D and VH-60N is now expected to extend beyond 2020. Funds will be utilized to manage and prepare, process, and incorporate Engineering Change Proposals (ECP) and implement changes to sustain and improve all Executive Helicopter Series system readiness including safety, mission availability, structural integrity, and component (avionics/systems) reliability, maintainability, operational weight, performance, and obsolescence conditions as they arise. This program contains the following efforts: Conversion of VH-60N engines to increase mission performance and reduce obsolescence conditions. Non-recurring engineering (NRE) efforts will include multiple ECPs for change kits, integration testing and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) updates to include technical data.  Recurring efforts include installation kits, installation equipment and installations. Replace/upgrade the ILS Avionics test benches, test sets and support equipment used to support VH unique avionics.  Replace/upgrade Air Vehicle Support Equipment and technical data to support VH unique Air Vehicle requirements. Effort will install new operating systems, replace obsolete components and core computers, test equipment and basic test program hardware. Replace/upgrade the cabin interiors for the VH-3D. Effort will upgrade VH-3D interior by replacing components to reduce aircraft operational weight and ease maintainability. The VH Comms Upgrade replaces obsolete communication  and enhances the quality of voice and data transfer in both the VH-3D and VH-60N platforms. The VH-3D Very Important Person (VIP) Seat Upgrade is part of the Cabin Interior modification program and will replace the VIP seat currently on the aircraft in order to meet required crashworthiness standards.  Additionally,the VIP seat will reduce aircraft operational weight.



DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  NRE for the VH-60N T700-401C engine conversions began in FY 2010. This modification will cover 24 engine upgrades for 8 installations on VH-60N helicopters. Three T700-401C engines are required per aircraft.  

Notes:									
							
1. Engine B-Kit quantity includes additional end items, which will not be part of initial installation.										
2. Avionics kits will be installed at the O level.										
3. VH Cabin Interior Redesign modifications include the VH-3D.										
4.  VH-3D Cabin Interior Redesign A kit costs increased during contractor proposal development.  			 											
5.  VH-3D Cabin Interior Redesign A kit in FY14 is the validation/verification kit.

6.  Due to budget constraints, VH-3D Engines, Performance Upgrade, VH-60N Cabin Interior Redesign and associated installs have been removed from FY15.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:   In order to meet the requirement of providing safe and timely transportation for the President, Vice President, and other parties as directed by the Director of the White House Military Office (WHMO), and in support of the alert and contingency mission requirement of the WHMO Operations Plan, a Trainer Conversion Program has been established to convert a H-3 and a H-60 into UH-3D and UH-60N flyable trainer aircraft.  The Trainer Conversion Program will alleviate flight hours on In Service VH aircraft thus preserving service life on national fleet assets.  The conversion will allow for modifications including the VH-60N Cockpit Upgrade, VH Communication Suite Upgrade, and VH-3D Lift Improvement. Funds will also be utilized to manage and prepare, process, and incorporate Engineering Change Proposals and implement changes that are made on all operational Executive Helicopter Series aircraft including safely, mission availability, structural integrity, and component (avionics/systems) reliability, maintainability, and obsolescence conditions as they arise.    


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Trainer Conversion Non-Recurring Engineering began in FY 2011.  Procurement efforts began in FY 2012. Completion of the Trainer Conversion Program is projected in FY 2015.


1.  As a cost savings initiative to the government, pre-existing H-3 and H-60 A kits are being used to perform conversions.	
											
2.  Common H-3 and H-60 parts were retained from the donor aircraft, therefore no A kit costs are required. 													
3.  B kits are comprised of VH/UH unique parts.

4.  Installation costs include teardown, inspection, repair and conversion of the aircraft.  Tasks to support these activities began in FY12.	

5.  The Other Support in FY15 is to continue to fund government support at the Prototype Integration Facility (PIF) to continue to support the UH-60N Trainer Aircraft efforts until the aircraft is delivered to the fleet in FY15.

Name.@footnote: VH-60N CUP aircraft avionics components inflate at a higher rate than standard inflation, hence the slightly higher acceleration.
Due to budget constraints in FY15 the majority of the remaining Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) for the VH-3D CUP will be delayed.

Organic - VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade Kit

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  In order to meet the requirement of providing safe and timely transportation for the President, Vice President, and other parties as directed by the Director of the White House Military Office (WHMO), and in support of the alert and contingency mission requirement of the WHMO Operations Plan, a VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade program has been established to extend the VH-3D service life requirements.  The VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade eliminates pending obsolescence & supportability issues with key avionics components and brings the VH-3D in compliance with mandated avionics capabilities (Communication Navigation Survellance/Air Traffic Management, Terrain Awareness Warning System/Ground Proximity Warning System). In addition, an upgraded cockpit improves system safety, reduces pilot workload and training requirements.  The baseline upgrade includes digital map and GPS approach functionality, bringing the VH-3D in line with VH-60N capabilities.  Modern, common avionics equipment will reduce logistics cost and increase reliability. 


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:    Procurement efforts for the VH-3D Cockpit Upgrade begin in FY 2012, with completion projected in FY 2022.  


Notes:  In FY13, the $15M Congressional Mark and sequestration caused major schedule realignments.

ImplementationMethodName.val: No Quantities Associated with Install

Description.val: VH-3D Lift Improvement Program (LIP) OSIP 011-06 completed in FY 2012 and has been moved to In-Active OSIPs.
